document.masterDocTitle: Coralliophilinae (Neogastropoda: Muricidae) from the southwest Pacific

mods:titleInfo.mods:title: Coralliophilinae (Neogastropoda: Muricidae) from the southwest Pacific
Mémoires du Muséum national d'Histoire naturelle

bibRefCitation.author: KOSUGE S. & OLIVERIO M.
bibRefCitation.refString: KOSUGE S. 1980 b. - Description of six new species of the genus Latiaxis KOSUGE S. & OLIVERIO M. 2001. - A new coralliophiline from the Southwest from the Philippines Sea. Bulletin of the Institute of Malacology of Tokyo Pacific (Muricidae: Coralliophilinae). Journal of Conchology 37: 285 - 1: 41 - 45. 290.

paragraph.materialsCitation: TYPE MATERIAL. — Holotype (lv) MNHN 0354 (Figs 211, 212) and 1 paratype MNHN 0353 , 1 paratype AMS , 1 paratype NMNZ , 1 paratype NM .

subSubSection.paragraph:
TYPE LOCALITY. —
Norfolk Ridge , 23°41’S , 168°01’E ,
245-260 m
[SMIB 4: DW 51]
.

DISTRIBUTION. —
Coral Sea , Norfolk Ridge and Loyalty Ridge , live in
300-385 m
, empty shells in
207-500 m
.

REMARKS. — Description and illustration of the protoconch are available in Kosuge & Oliverio (2001) . It is multispiral, consisting of 3.5 whorls (Protoconch-I of 0.8 whorls and Protoconch-II of 2.7 whorls), 890 Μm high, 800 Μm wide at the base.
